title: Jefferson National Expansion Memorial: Gateway Arch
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     Gateway Arch               Gateway Arch          Welcome to the Gateway Arch!  As the nation's tallest monument, the Gateway Arch has welcomed visitors for fifty years with its iconic, awe-inspiring shape. The vision of renowed architect Eero Saarinen, the Gateway Arch commemorates Thomas Jefferson's vision and St. Louis' role in the westward expansion of the United States.  What will you do first?  Purchase timed tickets to enter the facility online, at the Old Courthouse Visitor Center, or by phone at 1.877.982.1410.  Learn about the unique architecture of the Gateway Arch.  Answer your questions about the Arch  Learn about the tram to the top  Learn about the historic landscape design of the park  View downloadable images of the Arch   Â          Museum Closure Notice Questions and Answers Museum of Westward Expansion Closure and the Old Courthouse as the Gateway Arch Ticket and Visitor Center During Construction
